title: Comparing accelerations on various inclined planes

content.question: Two identical blocks each start at rest from the same height and slide down surfaces inclined at the same angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown. In Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, there is negligible friction between the block and the surface, while in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the surface is rough and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the surface is <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The acceleration of the block in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="a sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the acceleration of the block in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="a sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
